ExcelAlmaLookup.title: Suggestion: Search and retrieve barcodes and PIDs

comments.body:
Hello, and thank you for the very helpful response! Specifically I'm looking up item PIDs. Our SRU URL is https://bu.alma.exlibrisgroup.com/view/sru/01BOSU_INST.

Elizabeth Taft
Boston University Libraries

Hi Elizabeth,

I was looking at your institution's records, in particular the "AVA" field, as this is typically where holdings/item-level information can be found (see two examples below):

https://buprimo.hosted.exlibrisgroup.com/primo-explore/sourceRecord?vid=BU&docId=ALMA_BOSU121673398800001161
https://buprimo.hosted.exlibrisgroup.com/primo-explore/sourceRecord?vid=BU&docId=ALMA_BOSU121645360970001161

I see there are holdings-related IDs in fields AVA$8 and AVA$r, but I think these are likely not the item PIDs (because I can not retrieve anything when I try to search the item PID index with those values).  

If you give me a few examples of item PIDs you are looking for, I can see if these can be found anywhere in the records returned for them by the SRU.

Even if they are not retrievable yet, it is possible that the item PIDs could be retrieved if "ISO Holdings" is enabled as I described before.  But it looks like it is not enabled yet.  If your catalog administrator does so, please let me know and I can investigate further.  Thanks!

Tom

@sdellis thank you for the review! Action cable is removed from the package.json and the application code generally because I assessed that we weren't actually using it. Everything in there was generated from `rails new`. However it's still in Gemfile.lock because it's a rails dependency, so we can't actually remove it from there.
Action cable has a ruby piece and a javascript piece, so it is kind of 2 dependencies.
Looks like url-parse is no longer a dependency, so this is no longer needed.

allsearch_api.title: Swagger file does not conform to OpenAPI standard

comments.body: Hi, FWIW, Schemathesis usually works fine even if the schema does not conform to the spec 100% (as far as I see the changes in #168, it should be fine). Currently, the schema validation is disabled by default in Schemathesis CLI. Let me know if you need any help in integrating Schemathesis, I'd be happy to be involved :)

orangelight.title: Too much space between the icon and the text in the Search and Race Results Banner

comments.body: Reducing the horizontal space could prevent a line wrap on most non-mobile devices, and thus take up less vertical space.

I do prefer the exclamation chat bubble to the megaphone for the reasons given above, but let's also consider having no icon. The banner is already large and the color draws a lot of attention as well. The first time I saw it I was a bit overwhelmed, I think out of proportion to the reaction we'd want to induce.

princeton_ansible.title: Revert configuration changes to solr garbage collection

comments.body: Turns out the garbage collection settings in staging were not causing the solr reindexing issues. So we may want to deploy the newer GC config to production instead of reverting the changes - or deploy to staging from the branch, test performance, then redeploy from main and test again. Once we know which settings work better (if there is a difference), we can decide which settings to keep.

Additional earlier work in this area:
- https://github.com/pulibrary/pul_solr/blob/main/architecture-decisions/0003-remove-memory-tuning.md
- https://github.com/pulibrary/pul_solr/blob/main/architecture-decisions/0004-revert-memory-tuning.md

Since we have ADRs for earlier GC / heap changes, it might be nice to have one for whatever state we end up in here. It could summarize the supporting research and ensure that documentation stays current.
